page.title: 15EDUCATION OF SCORAIG PUPILS
page.content: THERE IS ONE PRIMARY SCHOOL ON SCORAIG.BECAUSE OF ITS ISOLATED POSITION THERE ARE NO VISITING TEACHERS.MANY PARENTS HELP OUT WITH SPECIALIST SKILLS.THE SCHOOL RE-OPENED 20 YEARS AGO AFTER 9yrs CLOSURE.THERE WERE THEN 3 PUPILS.BY 1985 THE ROLL WAS 14. THE SCHOOL BUILDING IS OVER 100yrs OLD.RECENTLY IT WAS REDECORATED AND A WIND GENERATOR PUT UP TO SUPPLY ELECTRICITY. PUPILS AND TEACHER WALK OR CYCLE TO SCHOOL.AT THE AGE OF 12 CHILDREN LEAVE SCORAIG SCHOOL TO GO TO SECONDARY SCHOOL.THEY USUALLY GO TO ULLAPOOL BUT SOME HAVE GONE TO SPECIALIST OR PRIVATE SCHOOLS IN EDINBURGH.THOSE AT ULLAPOOL COME HOME AT THE WEEKENDS BUT BOARD IN ULLAPOOL DURING THE WEEK.
